actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.J.Res. 24 (Rep. Bice):
        A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Walk-In Coolers and Walk-In Freezers".

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 42. Record Vote Number: 162 



 H.Con.Res. 14 (Rep. Arrington):
        A concurrent resolution establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2025 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2034.

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate.

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 169 


        -- Measure laid before Senate by motion.
 

 S.Amdt. 1717 (Sen. Graham):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 1717 proposed by Senator Graham.

PN12-11:
        Harmeet Dhillon, of California, to be an Assistant Attorney General

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 168 



 PN12-34:
        Mehmet Oz, of Pennsylvania, to be Administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 45. Record Vote Number: 164 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 45. Record Vote Number: 167 



 PN12-39:
        Dean Sauer, of Missouri, to be Solicitor General of the United States

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 163
Under the authority of the order of today, at 11:14 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Marshall in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  8:30 a.m. tomorrow.
